required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transcutaneous Spinal Cord Stimulation for Parkinson Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Transcutaneous Spinal Cord Stimulation for Freezing of Gait in Parkinson Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Spinal cord stimulation has been used to treat gait problems in Parkinson's disease, with positive results along some studies. The use of non-invasive stimulation can be an alternative to stimulate the spinal corn.

detailed_description.textblock: Spinal cord stimulation has been used to treat gait problems in Parkinson's disease, with positive results along some studies. The use of non-invasive stimulation can be an alternative to stimulate the spinal corn. In this pilot trial, the investigators recruit participants with Parkinson' disease and freezing of gait. The aim of the study is to explore the safety along the non-invasive magnetic thoracic spinal cord stimulation as well the effect on gait problems, especially freezing of gait, prospectively, in an open-label fashion.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is the freezing of gait score. 12-item scale, each item scores 3 points at maximum; the score ranges from 0-36; higher scores mean higher severity

secondary_outcome.description: Gait speed measured through the time to up and go - It uses the time that a person takes to rise from a chair, walk ten meters, turn around, walk back to the chair, and sit down.
The freezing of gait questionnaire assess the freezing of gait severity in 9-item scale ( ranging from 0-28 points); higher score mean higher severity

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of the intervention - urinary incontinence
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of Patients self report problems: urinary incontinence. The urinary incontinence will be measure through the Revised Urinary Incontinence Scale, ranging from 0 to 16. Higher scores mean higher the urinary symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of the intervention - lower limb strength.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of Patients self report problems: worsening in gait due to weakness. The lower limb strength will be measure through the neurologic exam. The force degree ranges from 0 - none, to 5 - normal strength.

intervention.description: Theta burst stimulation at thoracic level (T5) over 2 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of advanced idiopathic Parkinson's disease
- significant freezing of gait despite optimized treatment with medications and rehabilitation program
Exclusion Criteria:
- psychiatric symptoms
- dementia
- cardiac pacemaker

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital
